text: Karim Boukraa (born 7 March 1973 in France) is a French retired footballer and founder of the Deïzo Academy.Qui est Karim Boukraa, talent des cités de Haute- Normandie ? Actu.fr ==Scotland== Flying to Scotland on 3 August 2000 to discuss a deal with Greenock Morton,First division team news BBC Boukraa exited the Ton four months later to Ross County,Boukraa escapes to Highlands HeraldScotland citing unhappiness with Morton's directors.Profile Greenock Morton (blog) Assisting to beat Ayr United 2-0 on debut,Ayr United 0-2 Ross County BBC he was best known for his skillful performance during the 2000-01 Scottish Cup 4th Round between the Staggies and Scottish Premier League giants Rangers, despite losing 3-2.Ross County vs Rangers OoCities Earlier, the wideman said he would not be vigilant of their best players as he had previous French Cup experience with top clubs.Football : BOUKRAA: GERS ARE NOT SO BIG Daily Mirror (Thefreelibrary.com) Staying on for the 2001/02 season,Ross County's summer ins and outs BBC he helped County advance to the 2001–02 Scottish League Cup quarter-finals with a goal to knock out Dundee 2-1,Karim books County's place BBC but was eventually axed with three others.Football: It's Highland Clearance Time Warns Cooper Daily Record (Scotland - Questia.com) Thinking back to his years in Scotland, the Frenchman stated that "There, everything is done to put the footballer in the best possible environment".Boukraa, étape par Paris Normandie == References == == External links == * at Footballdatabase.eu * Soccerbase Profile * The Staggie Archive Profile Category:Living people Category:Angoulême-Soyaux Charente players Category:Rodez AF players Category:Ross County F.C. players Category:Ligue 1 players Category:French footballers Category:French expatriate footballers Category:Paris FC players Category:Le Havre AC players Category:Association football forwards Category:1973 births Category:Expatriate footballers in Scotland Category:Stade Brestois 29 players Category:Greenock Morton F.C. players Category:Gazélec Ajaccio players
title: Karim Boukraa
